sentences.en: ‘I hate to shatter your illusions,’ he said.
sentences.cn: “我不愿意打破你的幻想。”他说。

sentences.en: At first glance, it all seems an alchemist's illusion.
sentences.cn: 乍看上去, 它完全象是一位炼金术士的幻术.

sentences.en: Credit creates the illusion that you can own things without paying for them.
sentences.cn: 赊购会让人产生买东西不用付钱的错觉。

sentences.en: Even he still lives under the illusion that country life is somehow superior to town life.
sentences.cn: 甚至此人仍抱着幻觉,不知何故,农村生活就是优越于城市.

sentences.en: Floor-to-ceiling windows can give the illusion of extra height.
sentences.cn: 从地板直抵天花板的窗子会给人以高出实际距离的幻觉。

sentences.en: He cherished the illusion that everybody admires him.
sentences.cn: 他喜欢以为大家都羡慕他.

sentences.en: He is under the illusion that his position is secure.
sentences.cn: 他误以为他的地位很稳固.

sentences.en: He was unlikely to be satisfied with the illusion of power.
sentences.cn: 他不可能满足于这种虚幻的权力。

sentences.en: His mind could no longer distinguish between illusion and reality.
sentences.cn: 他的头脑已不再能分清幻觉和现实.

sentences.en: How strange are realities as opposed to illusion!
sentences.cn: 和幻想相反,现实是多么奇怪 啊 !

sentences.en: It created an illusion reality.
sentences.cn: 这造成了一种宛如真实的梦幻.

sentences.en: It is an illusion that the Arctic is dark in winter.
sentences.cn: 认为北极冬天一片黑暗是错误的。

sentences.en: It seems to me a fatal illusion to expect one's children simply to reproduce one's own views.
sentences.cn: 在我看来，期望孩子一味照搬自己的观点是一种后果极其严重的错误观念。

sentences.en: She had no illusions about her physical attractiveness.
sentences.cn: 她对自己外表的吸引力不抱幻想。

sentences.en: She was under no illusion that he loved her.
sentences.cn: 她不再幻想他爱她了。

sentences.en: Sloping walls on the bulk of the building create an optical illusion.
sentences.cn: 大楼主体的斜墙给人造成一种视错觉。

sentences.en: The appearance of alternatives, the possibility of an option, is an illusion.
sentences.cn: 可选方案的出现, 作出选择的可能性是一种幻觉.

sentences.en: The mirrors all round the walls give an illusion of greater space.
sentences.cn: 墙壁周围的镜子造成一种较大空间的假象.

sentences.en: The mirrors in the room gave an illusion of greater space.
sentences.cn: 房间里的镜子给人一种空间增大的错觉。

sentences.en: the world is under the illusion that the original painting still hangs in the Winter Palace.
sentences.cn: 全世界的人都错误地认为原画还挂在冬宫内。

sentences.en: They are under the illusion that talking effects great results.
sentences.cn: 他们误以为谈话会产生巨大的效果.

sentences.en: They were under the illusion that the company was doing well.
sentences.cn: 他们误以为该公司生意很好.

sentences.en: This eerie calm is an illusion.
sentences.cn: 这种怪诞的平静是一种假象。

trans.tran_en: an idea or opinion that is wrong, especially about yourself
